intro: Bakerella diplocrater, commonly known as the narrowleaf bakerella, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has opposite, narrow leaves and produces white or pale yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. Bakerella diplocrater is often found in wetland habitats and is of interest to botanists due to its ecological role and limited distribution.
